decks.notes: This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on ramping up quickly with Urza lands and Eldrazi temples to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures ahead of schedule. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Chalice of the Void and removal spells like Dismember and All Is Dust. Karn, the Great Creator acts as both a threat and a way to fetch artifacts from the sideboard, adding versatility to the deck. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, hard-hitting creatures and disrupt their game plan with a mix of control elements.

This deck focuses on quickly getting Death's Shadow onto the battlefield, utilizing cards like Street Wraith and Mishra's Bauble to lower your own life total. By disrupting the opponent's hand with Thoughtseize and Tidehollow Sculler, and removing threats with Fatal Push and Path to Exile, it aims to control the game while putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures. The deck also includes ways to search for key cards with Ranger-Captain of Eos and protect your creatures with Giver of Runes.

The main concept of this Modern UrzaTron Control deck is to assemble the Urza lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) in order to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the deck to cast powerful threats such as Karn, the Great Creator, Karn Liberated, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck also aims to control the game with cards like Relic of Progenitus and Oblivion Stone, while using cards like Sylvan Scrying and Ancient Stirrings to find key pieces. Ultimately, the deck wins through overwhelming its opponent with powerful threats and controlling the game to its advantage.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers to outvalue the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually building towards a win condition through card advantage and efficient removal. The deck utilizes a mix of board wipes, spot removal, and card draw to maintain board control and outlast the opponent. It also has a strong land base with utility lands to further control the game state. Overall, the deck aims to grind out wins through attrition and strategic play.

The main idea of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf, while disrupting their game plan with hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck also focuses on controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, and maintaining card advantage with cards like Dark Confidant and Seasoned Pyromancer. The deck's strategy is to overwhelm the opponent quickly before they can establish their own game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Bloodghast, Golgari Thug, and Stinkweed Imp, in order to bring back creatures like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam for explosive combos. Cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion help to fuel the graveyard, while Life from the Loam ensures a steady stream of land drops. Creeping Chill provides additional reach, and Conflagrate can be a powerful finisher. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a quick and resilient graveyard-based strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with cards like Vengevine, Gravecrawler, and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis using cards such as Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier, and then bringing them back onto the battlefield in quick succession to overwhelm your opponent. Cards like Insolent Neonate and Cryptbreaker facilitate this strategy by discarding cards and drawing more cards. The deck aims to create a rapid and powerful graveyard-based combo to outpace and outmatch your opponent in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this deck is to fill the graveyard as quickly as possible by utilizing cards like Faithless Looting, Stitcher's Supplier, and Insolent Neonate. Once the graveyard is full, the deck can bring back powerful creatures like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, and Vengevine to overwhelm the opponent. Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis serves as a powerful finisher, able to come back from the graveyard at a low cost. The deck also has some removal and control elements with cards like Lightning Axe and Cryptbreaker to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on filling up the graveyard quickly with dredge cards like Stinkweed Imp and Life from the Loam, while also utilizing cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion to dig deeper into the deck. The goal is to bring back creatures like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam from the graveyard to create a strong board presence and win the game through overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of creatures. Creeping Chill can also drain the opponent's life total while fueling the graveyard strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently play powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, supported by cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes utility lands like Eldrazi Temple and Blast Zone to help maintain a strong board presence. By utilizing Eldrazi synergy and resource denial, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays and powerful creatures to secure victory in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay by utilizing a variety of Human creature cards to quickly build a strong board presence. By playing cards like Noble Hierarch and Champion of the Parish, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game. Cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter disrupt the opponent's strategy, while creatures like Mantis Rider and Thalia's Lieutenant provide additional firepower. The use of Aether Vial allows for instant creature deployment, while Cavern of Souls ensures that Human creatures can't be countered.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Manamorphose to bring back Arclight Phoenixes for aggressive plays. It also utilizes cards like Thing in the Ice and Aria of Flame for additional pressure. Pyromancer Ascension and Finale of Promise provide extra value by doubling up on spells, while interaction is provided by cards like Lightning Bolt and Gut Shot. Surgical Extraction helps disrupt opponent strategies while maintaining card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast-paced, graveyard-centric game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying Arclight Phoenix and Thing in the Ice to apply early pressure on the opponent. It utilizes efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Faithless Looting to fuel graveyard interactions and trigger the Phoenix's recursion ability. The deck also includes cantrips and card draw spells to help find key pieces and maintain card advantage. Aria of Flame acts as a finisher to close out games, while also providing additional reach. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive game plan centered around the Arclight Phoenix.

The focus of this deck is to apply heavy pressure on the opponent by playing efficient threats and disrupting their game plan with hand disruption spells. The deck utilizes a combination of powerful creatures such as Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf, along with versatile removal spells like Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy to control the board. The addition of cards like Liliana of the Veil and Kolaghan's Command provide additional disruption and value. The goal is to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering their spells, removing their threats, and drawing cards to gain card advantage. With a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and planeswalker cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and ultimately outvalue the opponent. The goal is to establish a dominant board position while preventing the opponent from executing their own strategy effectively, leading to inevitability in the late game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while generating card advantage with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Narset, Parter of Veils. With a mix of permission spells, board wipes, and card draw, this deck strives to outvalue the opponent and lock them out of the game. The mana base is designed to support the control elements of the deck, ensuring consistent access to the right colors of mana for spells and abilities.
